text:
Just a few days after being sacked from the Kapil Sharma Show, Navjot Singh Sidhu has been banned from entering Mumbai's film city, claims a DNA report.
According to the report, the Federation of Western India Cine Employees announced their decision and wrote a letter to Film City managing director, urging them to ban the cricketer-turned-politician from entering the location’s premises.
Agencies
This is the same federation that had banned Pakistani artists from working in India and the release of Indian films in Pakistan.

Just to jog you through, Sidhu ran into a controversy after he said on the The Kapil Sharma Show that an entire nation (Pakistan) and its people should not be blamed for the deeds of a few men while commenting on the February 14 attack in Pulwama, that killed at least 40 CRPF jawans.
Since there, there has been hashtags including #SackSidhu, #BoycottKapilSharmaShow and #UnsubscribeSontyTV doing rounds on Twitter. After Sidhu was fired, Archana Puran Singh replaced him on the show.
